newsitem.title: LEBANON: Lebanon Jan-Sept trade deficit $4.7 bln.
newsitem.headline: Lebanon Jan-Sept trade deficit $4.7 bln.

text.p: Lebanon reported a $4.715 billion trade deficit in the first nine months of 1996 compared with $4.853 billion during the corresponding period of last year, customs figures showed.
Imports were $5.457 billion against exports of $742 million, compared with $5.433 billion and $580 million in the first nine months of 1995.

Italy and the United States topped the list of exporters to Lebanon with 11.58 percent and 11.22 percent respectively of the total for the first nine months of 1996. Germany and France followed with 8.76 percent and 8.4 percent.
Lebanese exports went to the United Arab Emirates 23.7 percent, Saudi Arabia 13.3 percent, Syria 7.8 percent and Kuwait 7.6 percent.
Main exports were paper and paper board, textiles and textile articles, machinery and mechanical appliances and pearls and precious and semi-precious stones.
Main imports were machinery, transport equipment, base metals and metal products, mineral products, prepared foodstuffs, vegetable products and live animals and animal products.
